'''Kelsea Nicole Ballerini''' (born September 12, 1993) is an American [[country pop]] singer and songwriter. A four-time [[Grammy Award]] nominee, she has gained success since the 2010s, being honored with the [[Academy of Country Music Awards#Special awards|Gene Weed Milestone Award]] at the [[Academy of Country Music Awards]] and the Rising Star Award at the [[Billboard Women in Music|''Billboard'' Women in Music]].

She began songwriting as a child and signed a contract with [[Black River Entertainment]] in 2014,<ref>{{Cite web|title=About {{!}} Black River Entertainment|url=https://www.blackriverent.com/about|access-date=June 9, 2021|website=Blackriverent.com}}</ref> releasing her debut studio album, ''[[The First Time (Kelsea Ballerini album)|The First Time]],'' and her second one ''[[Unapologetically]]'', followed in 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Abbey|first=Alison|date=October 13, 2017|title=Kelsea Ballerini Unapologetically Talks New Music, Love and Growing Up|url=https://parade.com/608697/alison-abbey/kelsea-ballerini-unapologetically-talks-new-music-love-and-growing-up/|access-date=June 9, 2021|website=Parade: Entertainment, Recipes, Health, Life, Holidays}}</ref> The two albums account for seven songs on the [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]] charts. She has five No. 1 singles on the latter, starting with her debut single "[[Love Me Like You Mean It]]", which made her the first female artist to send a debut single to the top of that chart since [[Carrie Underwood]] in 2006. It was followed by "[[Dibs (song)|Dibs]]" and "[[Peter Pan (Kelsea Ballerini song)|Peter Pan]]", whose peaks also made her the first female country artist to send her first three singles to the top of that chart since [[Wynonna Judd]]. 

Her third studio album, ''[[Kelsea]]'', and a counterpart [[Remix album|acoustic album]], ''[[Ballerini (album)|Ballerini]]'', were both released in 2020. The collaboration "[[Half of My Hometown]]" with [[Kenny Chesney]] garnered two [[Country Music Association Awards]]. Her fourth studio album, ''[[Subject to Change (Kelsea Ballerini album)|Subject to Change]]'' was released in 2022.

==Early life==
Ballerini, an [[only child]], grew up in [[Knoxville, Tennessee]]<ref name="allmusic">{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/kelsea-ballerini-mn0003312551/biography|title=Kelsea Ballerini biography|last=Leggett|first=Steve|work=[[Allmusic]]|access-date=December 9, 2014}}</ref> with her father Ed<ref name="cmt1">{{cite web|last1=Shelburne|first1=Craig|title=Next Women of Country: Kelsea Ballerini|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1746335/next-women-of-country-kelsea-ballerini/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141213015155/http://www.cmt.com/news/1746335/next-women-of-country-kelsea-ballerini/|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 13, 2014|website=CMT|access-date=June 23, 2015|date=December 5, 2014}}</ref><ref name="995qyk">{{cite web|title=Would Kelsea Ballerini ever change her name|url=http://995qyk.com/2015/04/18/would-kelsea-ballerini-ever-change-her-name/|website=99.5 QYK|access-date=June 23, 2015 |date=April 18, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150623152240/http://995qyk.com/2015/04/18/would-kelsea-ballerini-ever-change-her-name/ |archive-date=June 23, 2015 }}</ref> and her mother Carla. Ed was a sales manager at a country radio station and is of [[Italian people|Italian]] descent. Carla has worked in marketing for the [[Bible]] publishing division of [[Thomas Nelson (publisher)|Thomas Nelson]] and a sponsorship company.<ref name="995qyk" /> Kelsea started taking dance lessons at Premiere Dance Studio in [[Seymour, Tennessee]] when she was three and quit ten years later.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hudelson|first1=Molly|title=Country singer Kelsea Ballerini talks her debut EP, upcoming NYC show and more|url=http://www.axs.com/news/country-singer-kelsea-ballerini-talks-her-debut-ep-upcoming-nyc-show-a-40000|website=AXS|access-date=June 23, 2015|date=February 9, 2015}}</ref> She also sang in a church choir and the school choir.<ref name="cmt1"/> She wrote her first song at 12 for her mother<ref>{{cite web|last1=Mansfield|first1=Brian|title=On the Verge: Kelsea Ballerini means it|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/ontheverge/2015/04/05/kelsea-ballerini-love-me-like-you-mean-it-on-the-verge/70635632/|website=[[USA Today]]|access-date=June 23, 2015|date=April 5, 2015}}</ref> and moved to [[Nashville]] three years later.<ref name="allmusic"/> She attended [[Central High School (Knoxville, Tennessee)|Central High School]] in [[Knoxville, Tennessee]]; [[Centennial High School (Tennessee)|Centennial High School]] in [[Franklin, Tennessee]]; and [[Lipscomb University]] for two years until pursuing a musical career.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kelsea Ballerini experiences several firsts, headlines SGA Spring Concert |url=http://www.luminationnetwork.com/2015/04/09/kelsea-ballerini-experiences-several-firsts-headlines-sga-spring-concert/|website=Lumination Network|access-date=June 23, 2015|date=April 9, 2015|url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150623142315/http://www.luminationnetwork.com/2015/04/09/kelsea-ballerini-experiences-several-firsts-headlines-sga-spring-concert/ |archive-date=June 23, 2015 }}</ref>

==Career==
===2014–2016: Self-titled EP and ''The First Time''===
[[File:Kelsea Ballerini Country Artist 3 (cropped).jpg|left|thumb|Ballerini in 2014]]
At 19, Kelsea Ballerini signed a deal with [[Black River Entertainment]].<ref name="allmusic"/> In late 2014, she released her debut single "[[Love Me Like You Mean It]]", which debuted on the [[Country Airplay]] chart in October 2014.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6281325/tomorrows-hits-lillywood-robin-schulz-logic-kelsea-ballerini|title=Tomorrow's Hits: Lillywood & Robin Schulz, Logic, Kelsea Ballerini|date=October 10, 2014|magazine=Billboard|access-date=December 9, 2014}}</ref> She released a [[Kelsea Ballerini (EP)|self-titled extended play]] for the label in November.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/kelsea-ballerini-e.p./id940713706 |title=Kelsea Ballerini EP |work=iTunes Store |access-date=December 9, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150109222114/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/kelsea-ballerini-e.p./id940713706|archive-date=January 9, 2015}}</ref> She was named one of [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]]'s Next Women of Country in 2014. She performed for the first time at the [[Grand Ole Opry]] on February 14, 2015, and sang "Love Me Like You Mean It."<ref name="cmt1"/> On May 19, 2015, Ballerini's debut album ''[[The First Time (Kelsea Ballerini album)|The First Time]]'' was released through Black River. For the chart dated July 4, 2015, "Love Me Like You Mean It," the album's first single, reached number one on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart, making Ballerini the first solo female country music artist to score a number one hit with her debut single since [[Carrie Underwood]] did so with "[[Jesus, Take the Wheel]]" in 2006, and only the eleventh in history to achieve the feat.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Moss|first=Marissa R.|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/kelsea-ballerini-joins-carrie-underwood-in-elite-number-one-club-20150622 |title=Kelsea Ballerini Joins Carrie Underwood in Elite Number One Club|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=June 22, 2015 |access-date=March 2, 2016}}</ref> Ballerini also became only the fifth solo female country music artist to score back-to-back number one hits with her first two singles when "[[Dibs (song)|Dibs]]" reached the top of the Country Airplay chart and the first to do it since [[Jamie O'Neal]] in 2001.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6889333/kelsea-ballerini-has-dibs-on-second-country-airplay-no-1|title=Kelsea Ballerini Has 'Dibs' on Second Country Airplay No. 1|author=Jim Asker|date=February 23, 2016|publisher=Billboard.com|access-date=February 23, 2016}}</ref>
The album's third single, "[[Peter Pan (Kelsea Ballerini song)|Peter Pan]]," was released to country radio on March 21, 2016. "Peter Pan" reached number one on both the [[Country Airplay]] and [[Hot Country Songs]] charts in September, making Ballerini the first solo female country music artist to top both country music charts simultaneously.<ref name="same time">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7503747/kelsea-ballerini-tops-two-country-charts-same-time-peter-pan|title=Kelsea Ballerini Is the First Woman to Top Hot Country Songs & Country Airplay Charts at the Same Time|last=Asker|first=Jim|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|date=September 12, 2016|access-date=September 15, 2016}}</ref> The achievement made her the first solo female to send her first three singles to number one since [[Wynonna Judd]] accomplished the same feat in 1992.<ref name="same time"/> The album's fourth single, "[[Yeah Boy]]," was released to country radio on October 10, 2016.

===2017–2019: ''Unapologetically'', coaching ''The Voice'', and joining the Grand Ole Opry===
[[File:Kelsea Ballerini in concert in 2017.jpg|thumb|301x301px|Kelsea Ballerini in concert in 2017]]
In early 2017, Ballerini was named to [[Forbes|Forbes']] [[30 Under 30]] – Music list at number two.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kelsea Ballerini|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/kelsea-ballerini/|website=Forbes|access-date=January 5, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Bonaguro|first1=Alison|title=Kelsea Ballerini Named No. 2 Forbes' "30 Under 30" List|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1775317/kelsea-ballerini-named-no-2-forbes-30-under-30-list/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170105062545/http://www.cmt.com/news/1775317/kelsea-ballerini-named-no-2-forbes-30-under-30-list/|url-status=dead|archive-date=January 5, 2017|website=CMT News|access-date=January 5, 2017}}</ref> In 2017, she received two [[Academy of Country Music Award]] nominations for Female Vocalist of the Year and Video of the Year for "Peter Pan."<ref name="ACM 2017 noms" /> In June 2017, Ballerini released "[[Legends (Kelsea Ballerini song)|Legends]]" as the first single from her second studio album.<ref>{{cite magazine|last1=Gugala|first1=John|title=Hear Kelsea Ballerini's Wistful New Song 'Legends'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/news/kelsea-ballerinis-legends-hear-the-new-song-w486223|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=June 7, 2017|access-date=June 26, 2017}}</ref> On November 3, she released her second album, titled ''[[Unapologetically]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling |title=Kelsea Ballerini Announces Title, Date for Second Album|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/kelsea-ballerini-second-album-unapologetically-release-date/ |website=Taste of Country|date=July 25, 2017 |access-date=October 4, 2018}}</ref> The album debuted at number three on the [[Billboard Top Country Hits|Billboard Top Country Album Chart]] and number seven on the [[Billboard 200]] Album Chart, making it her highest-charting album on both charts.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Kelsea Ballerini Chart History |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/kelsea-ballerini/chart-history/tlp/ |magazine=Billboard}}</ref>

The second single from the album, "[[I Hate Love Songs]]", was released in March.<ref name="i hate love songs">{{cite web |title=Single Releases : MusicRow – Nashville's Music Industry Publication – News, Songs From Music City |url=https://musicrow.com/calendars-2/single-releases/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180222214933/https://musicrow.com/calendars-2/single-releases/ ===2019–2021: ''Kelsea'' and ''Ballerini''===
[[File:Kelsea Ballerini performing at Red Rocks Amphitheater 2021 4 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Kelsea Ballerini performing at [[Red Rocks Amphitheatre]] in 2021]]
In July 2019, Ballerini confirmed in an [[Instagram]] post that work on her third studio album was complete.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.iheart.com/content/2019-07-29-kelsea-ballerinis-third-studio-album-is-officially-complete/|website=Iheart.com|access-date=August 1, 2019|title=Kelsea Ballerini's Third Studio Album Is Officially Complete|date=July 27, 2019 }}</ref> On September 6, 2019, Ballerini released the first single off of her then upcoming third album, titled "[[Homecoming Queen?]]"<ref>{{cite web |last1=Henderson |first1=Wendy |title=Kelsea Ballerini Cries in Raw "Homecoming Queen" Video |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kelsea-ballerini-homecoming-queen-video/ |website=Taste of Country |date=September 8, 2019 |access-date=September 13, 2019}}</ref> The song debuted at number 22 on the [[Country Airplay]] chart, making it Ballerini's highest debut on the chart to date.<ref>{{cite tweet|user=FiddleSabre |last1=Owen |first1=Chris |number=1171161603829575681 |title= "homecoming queen?" by @KelseaBallerini debuts at #22 on Billboard Country Airplay this week.|date=September 9, Stay Home in Sleek New Song 'Club' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/kelsea-ballerini-new-song-club-909885/ |magazine=Rolling Stone |access-date=November 8, 2019 |date=November 8, 2019}}</ref> Ballerini confirmed on January 20, 2020, that the album is self-titled (''[[Kelsea]]'') and was released March 20, 2020.<ref name="nash daily">{{cite news |last1=Casey |first1=Jim |title=Kelsea Ballerini to Release Third Album, "Kelsea," on March 20 |url=http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2020/01/23/kelsea-ballerini-to-release-third-album-kelsea-on-march-20/ |access-date=January 23, 2020 |work=[[Nash Country Daily]] |date=January 23, 2020}}</ref> The announcement coincided with the release of a second promotional single, "LA".<ref name="nash daily"/> On February 28, she released the single "[[Hole in the Bottle]]" (stylized in all lowercase) and announced the tracklist for ''Kelsea'', including "[[Half of My Hometown]]" featuring [[Kenny Chesney]] and "[[The Other Girl (song)|The Other Girl]]" featuring [[Halsey (singer)|Halsey]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Dukes |first1=Billy |title=Kelsea Ballerini Unveils Kenny Chesney, Halsey Duets |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kelsea-ballerini-kenny-chesney-album-track-list/ |website=Taste of Country |date=February 27, 2020 |access-date=February 28, 2020}}</ref>

On September 2, Ballerini announced she would be releasing a counterpart album to ''Kelsea'', titled ''[[Ballerini (album)|Ballerini]]'', featuring stripped-down versions of the songs. It was released on September 11, 2020. The stripped-down version of "Club" was released alongside the album announcement.<ref>{{cite tweet|user=KelseaBallerini|number=1301201859730911232|title=ballerini 9.11.20 // club out in 10 minutes|date=September 2, 2020|access-date=September 11, 2020}}</ref> She described ''Ballerini'' as "emotional, vulnerable and soft" while ''Kelsea'' showed her "bold and effervescent" side.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/kelsea-ballerini-new-album-ballerini-1054438/|title=Kelsea Ballerini Announces Stripped Album 'Ballerini'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|last=Hudak|first=Joseph|date=September 2, 2020|access-date=September 11, 2020}}</ref> As of October 16, 2020, ''Kelsea'' and ''Ballerini'' can be purchased physically as a [[double album]], exclusively from [[Target Corporation|Target]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Kelsea Ballerini - "kelsea {{!}} ballerini" (CD) |url=https://www.target.com/p/kelsea-ballerini-34-kelsea-ballerini-34-cd/-/A-81280324|website=[[Target Corporation|Target]]|access-date=September 29, 2021}}</ref>

===2022–2024: ''Subject to Change'', ''Rolling Up the Welcome Mat'', and ''The Voice''===
In March 2022 Ballerini announced that "[[Heartfirst]]" would be released April 8, 2022. The song serves as the first single from her fourth studio album, ''[[Subject to Change (Kelsea Ballerini album)|Subject to Change]]''.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/kelsea-ballerini-announces-new-album-subject-to-change-1235113804/|title=Kelsea Ballerini Announces New Album 'Subject to Change': Here's When It Arrives|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|last=Nicholson|first=Jessica|date=July 13, 2022|access-date=July 14, 2022}}</ref> While co-hosting during the [[2022 CMT Music Awards]], Ballerini performed the song for the first time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1844034/2022-cmt-music-awards-host-kelsea-ballerini-debuts-new-anthem-heartfirst/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220412065857/http://www.cmt.com/news/1844034/2022-cmt-music-awards-host-kelsea-ballerini-debuts-new-anthem-heartfirst/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=April 12, 2022 |title= 2022 CMT Music Awards: Host Kelsea Ballerini Debuts New Anthem, "HEARTFIRST" |work=CMT|last=Goldstein|first=Tiffany|date=April 12, 2022|access-date=April 12, 2022}}</ref> The music video for the song premiered July 7, 2022.<ref name="O'Connell">{{cite web|url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/kelsea-ballerini-debuts-new-song-love-is-a-cowboy-announces-new-album-subject-to-change/|title=Kelsea Ballerini Debuts New Song "Love Is A Cowboy," Announces New Album 'Subject To Change'|work=musicmayhemmagazine|last=O'Connell|first=Madeleine|date=July 16, 2022|access-date=July 16, 2022}}</ref> On July 15, 2022, a promotional single, "Love is a Cowboy" was released along with the official music video.<ref name="O'Connell"/> The album features a collaboration, "[[You're Drunk, Go Home]]", with [[Kelly Clarkson]] and [[Carly Pearce]]. The album was released on September 23, 2022.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Norwin|first1=Alyssa|title=Carly Pearce Teases 'Super Fun' New Song With Kelsea Ballerini & Kelly Clarkson |url=https://hollywoodlife.com/2022/09/12/carly-pearce-kelly-clarkson-kelsea-ballerini-song-acm-honors-interview/|website=Hollywood Life|date=September 12, 2022|access-date=September 12, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Kelsea Ballerini opens up about post-divorce album 'Subject to Change': 'I just acknowledge that life is so messy' |url=https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/kelsea-ballerini-post-divorce-album-subject-to-change-i-just-acknowledge-that-life-is-so-messy-193321511.html |access-date=September 23, 2022 |website=www.yahoo.com |date=September 22, 2022}}</ref> In November 2022, "Heartfirst" was nominated for [[Best Country Solo Performance]] at the [[65th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Liebig |first=Lorie|title=BREAKING: 2023 Grammy Nominees Announced |url=https://theboot.com/2023-grammy-awards-nominees-country-americana/ |access-date=December 7, 2022 |website=The Boot |date=November 15, 2022}}</ref> On December 5, 2022, "[[If You Go Down (I'm Goin' Down Too)]]", was released as the album's second single. On February 13, 2023, Ballerini announced that her short film and EP ''[[Rolling Up the Welcome Mat]]'' would be released the next day.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kelsea-ballerini-ep-short-film-rolling-up-the-welcome-mat| title=Kelsea Ballerini Announces Surprise EP + Short Film, 'Rolling Up The Welcome Mat'| author= Carena Liptak| publisher=Taste of Country| date=February 13, 2023| access-date=February 13, 2023}}</ref> Promoting the EP, she performed "Blindsided" and "Penthouse" on the March 5, 2023, episode of [[Saturday Night Live (season 48)|Saturday Night Live]].<ref>{{cite news |url= https://lahoreherald.com/kelsea-ballerini-steals-the-show-with-debut-performance-on-saturday-night-live/ |title= Kelsea Ballerini Steals the Show with Debut Performance on Saturday Night Live|date= March 5, 2023 |website= Lahore Herald}}</ref>

On June 5, 2024, it was announced that Ballerini would be featured as a coach on the [[The Voice (American TV series) season 27|27th season]] of ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]'' which is set to air spring 2025.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Adam Levine Returns to 'The Voice'! Singer Joins Season 27 Alongside Kelsea Ballerini, Michael Buble and John Legend |url=https://people.com/adam-levine-returning-to-the-voice-for-season-27-alongside-kelsea-ballerini-michael-buble-john-legend-8658141 |access-date=June 5, 2024 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref>

===2024–present: ''Patterns''===
On August 8, 2024, Ballerini announced her fifth studio album ''Patterns'', and that the song "Sorry Mom" would be released the following day. The album will be released on October 25, 2024.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/kelsea-ballerini-album-patterns |title=Kelsea Ballerini's New Album, 'Patterns', Is On Its Way |author=Liptak, Carena |publisher=Taste of Country |date=August 8, 2024 |access-date=August 8, 2024}}</ref>

In September 2024, it was announced that Ballerini will make her acting debut in a guest role on the upcoming [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] series ''[[Doctor Odyssey]]''.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kelsea Ballerini Shares How Boyfriend Chase Stokes Supported Her in Acting Debut on Doctor Odyssey (Exclusive) |url=https://people.com/kelsea-ballerini-on-boyfriend-chase-stokes-support-for-doctor-odyssey-acting-debut-exclusive-8715325#:~:text=Kelsea%20Ballerini%20was%20in%20good,available%20to%20ease%20her%20nerves. |last=Moore|first=Julia |date=September 19, 2024 |website=People Magazine |access-date=September 26, 2024}}</ref>

==Influences==
Ballerini has been influenced by artists in both the pop music and country music fields. Originally influenced by pop music, Ballerini states "I grew up on top 40 pop. I didn't know what country music was, which is so funny because I grew up in [[East Tennessee]]."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://radio.com/2015/05/14/kelsea-ballerini-the-first-time-interview-positive-songs-taylor-swift-new-music-to-know/|title=Kelsea Ballerini on Her New Album, Taylor Swift & Staying 'Positive': New Music to Know|access-date=April 30, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170817081204/http://radio.com/2015/05/14/kelsea-ballerini-the-first-time-interview-positive-songs-taylor-swift-new-music-to-know/|archive-date=August 17, 2017|url-status=dead}}</ref> Ballerini lists [[Britney Spears]], [[Christina Aguilera]], [[NSYNC]], and [[Hilary Duff]] among these early artists influencing her.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.argusleader.com/story/blogs/scotthudson/2015/08/19/chart-topping-kelsea-ballerini-loves-pizza-songwriting/31991065/|title=Chart-topping Kelsea Ballerini loves pizza, songwriting|website=Argus Leader|access-date=April 30, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/videos/see-kelsea-ballerini-cover-britney-spears-nsync-in-nineties-medley-20150723|title=See Kelsea Ballerini Cover Britney Spears, N'Sync in Nineties Medley|date=July 23, 2015|magazine=Rolling Stone|access-date=April 30, 2016}}</ref> Ballerini also cites [[Justin Bieber]] as an early pop musical inspiration.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Watch Kelsea Ballerini Sing Justin Bieber, Taylor Swift, and Cher in a Game of Song Association|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/music/a31187981/kelsea-ballerini-song-association/|date=March 3, 2020|website=Elle.com|access-date=May 17, 2020}}</ref> It was not until Ballerini heard "[[Stupid Boy]]" by [[Keith Urban]] that she decided to delve deeper into country music by listening to albums by [[Taylor Swift]], [[Sugarland]], and [[Dixie Chicks]]. She credited Swift's [[Taylor Swift (album)|self-titled debut studio album]] for introducing her to country music. Ballerini also cites [[Shania Twain]] as her greatest influence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/kelsea-ballerini-interview|title=Kelsea Ballerini Says She'll Never Stray From Her Country Roots|last=Nesvig|first=Kara|website=Teen Vogue|date=February 23, 2016|access-date=April 30, 2016}}</ref> She has also performed songs originally recorded by [[Alison Krauss]] and sang "[[Ghost in This House]]" alongside Krauss at the CMT Artists of the Year Awards in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PU_4E_sF8W8 |title=Kelsea Ballerini - "Ghost In This House" | Live at the Grand Ole Opry | Opry |publisher=[[YouTube]] |date=August 10, 2016 |access-date=June 9, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web | url=https://vimeo.com/296307613 | title=Kelsea Ballerini & Alison Krauss | Ghost in This House | 2018 CMT Artists of the Year Performance|website=Vimeo.com}}</ref>

==Personal life==
[[File:Morgan And Kelsea CMC Awards 2016.jpg|upright=1.1|alt=Morgan Evans and Kelsea Ballerini in March 2016|thumb|[[Morgan Evans (singer)|Morgan Evans]] and Kelsea Ballerini during a [[Planet Country with Big Stu & MJ|Planet Country]] interview on the [[Country Music Channel|CMC Awards]] red carpet in March 2016 around the time their relationship started]]

In March 2016, Ballerini began dating Australian country singer [[Morgan Evans (singer)|Morgan Evans]]. They became engaged on Christmas Day 2016<ref>{{cite web|author=Sarah Michaud |url=http://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-engaged-morgan-evans-see-the-ring/ |title=Kelsea Ballerini Engaged to Morgan Evans - See the Ring |website=People.com |date=December 25, 2016 |access-date=June 9, 2017}}</ref> and were married on December 2, 2017, in [[Cabo San Lucas, Mexico]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kelsea Ballerini and Morgan Evans' Wedding Album |url=https://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-morgan-evans-wedding-album-photos-2/ |access-date=June 9, 2024 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref> On August 29, 2022, Ballerini announced that she and Evans were divorcing.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-files-for-divorce-morgan-evans|title=Kelsea Ballerini Files for Divorce from Morgan Evans: 'Deeply Difficult Decision'|author1=Rachel Desantis |author2=Melody Chiu |magazine=People|date=August 29, 2022|access-date=August 30, 2022}}</ref> On November 3, 2022, it was revealed that Ballerini and Evans had reached a settlement agreement, and their divorce was finalized on November 15, 2022.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-and-morgan-evans-reach-divorce-settlement-agreement|title=Kelsea Ballerini and Morgan Evans Reach Settlement Agreement 2 Months After She Filed for Divorce |author1=Daniela Avila |author2=Rachel DeSantis |magazine=People|date=November 3, 2022|access-date=November 4, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-says-she-spent-grammy-nom-day-finalizing-divorce|title=Kelsea Ballerini Spent Grammy Nom Day 'Finalizing' Divorce and Picking Up Keys to 'Dream Home'|author=Rachel DeSantis|magazine=People|date=November 16, 2022|access-date=November 16, 2022}}</ref>

In February 2023, it was confirmed that Ballerini was dating ''[[Outer Banks (TV series)|Outer Banks]]'' actor [[Chase Stokes]]. The couple reportedly began dating in December 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kelsea Ballerini and Chase Stokes' Relationship Timeline |url=https://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-and-chase-stokes-relationship-timeline/ |access-date=June 9, 2024 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Kelsea Ballerini Kisses Chase Stokes on the Cheek in Adorable Photo |url=https://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-kisses-chase-stokes-on-cheek-photo/ |access-date=February 28, 2023 |website=People}}</ref>

Ballerini attended [[Central High School (Knoxville, Tennessee)|Central High School]], and witnessed the [[Central High School (Knoxville, Tennessee)#2008 shooting|2008 shooting]]. She has said she suffers from [[post-traumatic stress disorder]] as a result of the experience.<ref>{{Cite web|date=November 17, 2021|first=Jeff|last=Nelson|title=Kelsea Ballerini Talks About PTSD from Witnessing School Shooting, Says Concerts Can Trigger Her|url=https://people.com/country/kelsea-ballerini-ptsd-triggers-after-witnessing-school-shooting/|access-date=November 26, 2021|website=People.com}}</ref>
